name: HEAR CI Prediction Model
intended_use: Support clinicians estimating outcome probability for cochlear implantation
Decision support tool in pre-operative planning
not_intended_for: Autonomous clinical decisions without human oversight
Legal or administrative decisions without human review
limitations: Predictions should be interpreted as supportive evidence, not deterministic outcomes
Performance may degrade for edge cases not represented in training data
recommendations: Use only as support tool alongside expert clinical judgment
Human medical judgment has priority in all cases
Regular evaluation and retraining recommended (every 6 months)
Monitor prediction accuracy with feedback system

ethical_considerations.fairness: Model tested for bias across age groups and gender. No significant discrimination detected.
ethical_considerations.privacy: All patient data anonymized according to GDPR requirements
ethical_considerations.transparency: SHAP explanations provided for all predictions to ensure interpretability

changelog: Improved hyperparameters and added class weighting to handle imbalanced data. Accuracy improved from 0.74 (v2) to 0.76 (v3). Better recall for minority class (0.76 vs 0.75).
